com.phunware.engagement.internal.database

Interface SQLiteDatabaseManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SQLiteDatabaseManagerImpl

    public SQLiteDatabaseManager

    Manages creation of the encrypted database for use by DatabaseHelpers. Supplies a single point of entry to create the database so that encryption details don't need to be widely known by consumers. Also manages

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      net.sqlcipher.database.SQLiteDatabase getReadableDatabase()
      Returns a read-only connection to the backing SQLiteDatabase. There is no need to close the database connection, and it can actually cause problems since we have such high concurrency writes. https://groups.google.com/d/msg/android-developers/DAkbe6rzxXY/U9cnw_VTubUJ
      net.sqlcipher.database.SQLiteDatabase getWritableDatabase()
      Returns a read-write connection to the backing SQLiteDatabase. There is no need to close the database connection, and it can actually cause problems since we have such high concurrency writes. https://groups.google.com/d/msg/android-developers/DAkbe6rzxXY/U9cnw_VTubUJ
      void registerHelper()
      Adds a SQLiteDatabaseManager to the Database and calls SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onCreate or SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade as needed, depending on the helper's version.

    • Method Detail

      • registerHelper

        void registerHelper()

        Adds a SQLiteDatabaseManager to the Database and calls SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onCreate or SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade as needed, depending on the helper's version.

        See Also:
        SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onCreate, SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade

      • getReadableDatabase

        net.sqlcipher.database.SQLiteDatabase getReadableDatabase()

        Returns a read-only connection to the backing SQLiteDatabase. There is no need to close the database connection, and it can actually cause problems since we have such high concurrency writes. https://groups.google.com/d/msg/android-developers/DAkbe6rzxXY/U9cnw_VTubUJ

        Returns:
        The backing database.

      • getWritableDatabase

        net.sqlcipher.database.SQLiteDatabase getWritableDatabase()

        Returns a read-write connection to the backing SQLiteDatabase. There is no need to close the database connection, and it can actually cause problems since we have such high concurrency writes. https://groups.google.com/d/msg/android-developers/DAkbe6rzxXY/U9cnw_VTubUJ

        Returns:
        The backing database.
